title: wadoh_raccoon
text:
NORTHWEST PATHOGEN GENOMICS CENTER OF EXCELLENCE


wadoh_raccoon python package

A Python package for transforming and linking pathogen sequencing/subtyping metadata.

title: wadoh_raccoon
text:
Installation 

installinstall specific version


uv pip install git+https://github.com/NW-PaGe/wadoh_raccoon.git#egg=wadoh_raccoon


To install a specific version, find the git tag noted in the GitHub Release section (something like v0.2.5) and then put it in the install statement like .git@v0.2.5:
uv pip install git+https://github.com/NW-PaGe/wadoh_raccoon.git@v0.2.5#egg=wadoh_raccoon

title: helpers
text:
Functions



Name
Description




date_format
Format Dates


gt_style
Style for GT Tables


save_raw_values
save raw values




date_format
wadoh_raccoon.utils.helpers.date_format(col)
Format Dates
Convert string dates into a yyyy-mm-dd format. The function uses pl.coalesce to try to process different formats. For example, it will first try to convert m/d/y, and then if that doesn’t work it will try d/m/y.
Note: it won’t attempt to convert excel dates.

Usage
To be applied to a string date column.


Parameters



Name
Type
Description
Default




col
str
a string column that has a date
required





Returns



Name
Type
Description




output_date
date
a date column





Examples

import polars as pl
from wadoh_raccoon.utils import helpers


df = pl.DataFrame({
    "dates": [
        "2024-10-30",     # ISO format
        "30/10/2024",     # European format
        "10/20/2024",     # US format
        "10-30-2024",     # US format
        "October 30, 2024",  # Full month name format,
        "45496",           # an excel date LOL
        "2022-12-27 08:26:49"
    ]
})

helpers.gt_style(
    df
    .with_columns(
        new_date=helpers.date_format('dates')
    )
)

dates
new_date

gt_style
wadoh_raccoon.utils.helpers.gt_style(
    df_inp,
    title='',
    subtitle='',
    add_striping_inp=True,
    index_inp=True,
)
Style for GT Tables

Usage
Apply this style to a Polars DataFrame


Examples

import polars as pl
from wadoh_raccoon.utils import helpers
df = pl.DataFrame({
    "x": [1,1,2],
    "y": [1,2,3]
})

A table with a title/subtitle:

helpers.gt_style(df_inp=df,title="My Title",subtitle="My Subtitle")

save_raw_values
wadoh_raccoon.utils.helpers.save_raw_values(df_inp, primary_key_col)
save raw values

Usage
Converts a polars dataframe into a dataframe with all columns in a struct column. It’s good for saving raw outputs of data.


Parameters









Name
Type
Description
Default




df_inp
pl.DataFrame
a polars dataframe
required


primary_key_col
str
column name for the primary key (submission key, not person/case key)
required





Returns



Name
Type
Description




df
pl.DataFrame
a dataframe





Examples

import polars as pl
from wadoh_raccoon.utils import helpers

data = pl.DataFrame({
    "lab_name": ["PHL", "MFT", "ELR","PHL"],
    "first_name": ["Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "Charlie"],
    "last_name": ["Smith", "Johnson", "Williams", "Williams"],
    "WA_ID": [1,2,4,4]
})

received_submissions_df = (
        helpers.save_raw_values(df_inp=data,primary_key_col="WA_ID")
)

helpers.gt_style(data)
